paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary variant transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with predominant symptoms of polyneuropathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common TTR variant associated with ATTRv is the p.Val50Met mutation.
Parental and geographic origin dictates penetrance of the disease.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val50Met mutation is responsible for 50% of the mutations associated with ATTRv worldwide.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly maternal inheritance shows increased penetrance.
variants.population_frequency: Common in endemic regions such as Portugal, Sweden, and Japan.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.source_location: Genetics of ATTRv Amyloidosis and Subsequent Polyneuropathy section.
variants.additional_notes: The p.Val50Met mutation is more often associated with polyneuropathy as the dominant symptom.
key_quotes: Parental and geographic origin dictates penetrance of the disease.
The p.Val50Met mutation is responsible for 50% of the mutations associated with ATTRv worldwide.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary variant transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with predominant symptoms of polyneuropathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: For example, 89% of patients with ATTRv in Bulgaria present with the Glu89Gln mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Glu89Gln mutation is associated with a high penetrance of disease.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on regional studies.
variants.source_location: Genetics of ATTRv Amyloidosis and Subsequent Polyneuropathy section.
variants.additional_notes: The Glu89Gln mutation is particularly prevalent in Bulgaria.
key_quotes: 89% of patients with ATTRv in Bulgaria present with the Glu89Gln mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
